page.title: 13LOCAL HISTORY.
page.content: On the western side of Mounts Bay between Newlyn and Mousehole is a well -known anchoring place called Gwavas Lake. Where the sea is now there used to be a forest. In the middle of the forest was a lake. A hermit lived beside the lake and many people visited his oratory because they felt that his prayers and the waters of the lake would cure their ills. But at some point the forest was flooded and everything submerged. Those who survived built another church and dedicated it to the saint of the lake,St.Pol or St. Paul. This flood separated the Isles of Scilly from the mainland. .
